Detailed Description

The Row class is a collection of Field values.

Data is stored and retrieved through rows. A row is a set of temporary buffers for storing the contents of database fields.

Each field in a row can be stored in one of three location:

  • Managed internal buffer,
  • A local variable referenced by memory address, or
  • A memory of data structure.

A row variable is independent of any specific row in the database can be re-used for many insert, fetch and update operations.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ Row() [1/2]

storage::data::Row::Row ( const RowDefinition &  columns__)
explicitprotected

Create a row for a known set of columns.

Field bindings are created for each field definition in columns.

Parameters
columns__A row definition that will remain valid for the life of this object.

◆ Row() [2/2]

storage::data::Row::Row ( const RowDefinition &  columns__,
size_t  field_count 
)
protected

Create a row before the row definition is ready.

This constructor can be called before columns is initialized, as it only captures a reference to the row definition object. No field bindings are created.

Parameters
columns__A row definition that will remain valid for the life of this object.
field_countThe maximum number of fields in the row.
Note
The row definition may optionally be left empty. If columns is empty, fields can be accessed by fieldno but not by name and the row will appear empty when treated as a collection.

Member Function Documentation

◆ set_by_fieldno()

db_result_t storage::data::Row::set_by_fieldno ( const Row &  o)

Copy values from another row by field position.

Parameters
oAnother Row object
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid row handle.
    • DB_EFIELD Field error. Invalid field number.
    • DB_ECONVERT Incompatible types: conversion is not possible.
    • DB_EBINDSIZE Invalid bind size.

◆ set_by_name()

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EFIELD Field error. Invalid field number.
    • DB_ECONVERT Incompatible types: conversion is not possible.
    • DB_EBINDSIZE Invalid bind size.

◆ bind() [1/10]

db_result_t storage::data::Row::bind ( db_fieldno_t  fieldno)
inline

Bind a field in a row to a variable with given field no.

Parameters
fieldnoField index number
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Number of fields being bound is 0, binding structure is not valid, data type is not known and autosize is selected.
    • DB_EBINDSIZE Invalid bind size.Datatype and size dont match.

Bind a column to an absolute memory address.

Parameters
fieldnoField number
data_typevariable type
data_ptrdata memory address
data_sizeSize of data
data_ind
data_flagsData type flags
  • DB_BIND_RELATIVE Relative binding using memory offset.
  • DB_BIND_ABSOLUTE Absolute binding using memory address.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid row handle.
